Reason: The trickle_fsync configuration is considered performance-sensitive. This is because enabling trickle_fsync directly affects the system performance by determining when to fsync() at intervals during sequential writing. The developer's explanation also highlights that enabling trickle_fsync can introduce overhead in terms of system resources and potentially affect the overall performance of the system, especially on platter-based storage. Therefore, the configuration is performance-sensitive as it directly and substantially affects system performance at the system level.
